intro: Gratiola odorata, commonly known as sweet alyssum, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is characterized by its small, fragrant flowers that range in color from white to pink, and it typically grows in moist, well-drained soils. The plant belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and it is often found in meadows and along stream banks. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a mild, aromatic scent, while its roots are sometimes used in traditional medicine.
